slides.title: <mark>5 Micro-Boundaries</mark> to Protect Your Focus This Week

slides.body:
Focus is a gate, not a faucet.

Small boundaries keep the noise out.

Here are <mark>5 micro-boundaries</mark> you can set in 5 minutes:

slides.title: <mark>Silence your top distraction</mark>
slides.body:
Phone? Email? Slack? Choose one channel to mute for an hour.

Let it buzz later.

slides.title: <mark>Script your 'no, thank you'</mark>
slides.body:
Have a default polite reply ready for meeting invites and ask-for-favors.

Speed + clarity beats waffling.

slides.title: <mark>Close tabs with a purpose</mark>
slides.body:
If a tab isn't linked to your 3 outcomes today, close it.

Context switching is attention tax.

slides.title: <mark>Do a 2-minute reset</mark>
slides.body:
Stand up. Breathe. Straighten your desk. Sip water.

Tiny rituals reboot better than caffeine.

slides.title: <mark>Block your next step</mark>
slides.body:
End your work session by writing down the first 2 sentences or clicks for tomorrow.

Future you will thank you.
Which micro-boundary will you set today?
